globalAttributes.name: hx-get
globalAttributes.description: issues a `GET` to the specified URL

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-get
globalAttributes.description: issues a `GET` to the specified URL

globalAttributes.name: hx-post
globalAttributes.description: issues a `POST` to the specified URL

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-post
globalAttributes.description: issues a `POST` to the specified URL

globalAttributes.name: hx-on
globalAttributes.description: handle events with inline scripts on elements

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-on
globalAttributes.description: handle events with inline scripts on elements

globalAttributes.name: hx-push-url
globalAttributes.description: push a URL into the browser location bar to create history

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-push-url
globalAttributes.description: push a URL into the browser location bar to create history

globalAttributes.name: hx-select
globalAttributes.description: select content to swap in from a response

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-select
globalAttributes.description: select content to swap in from a response

globalAttributes.name: hx-select-oob
globalAttributes.description: select content to swap in from a response, somewhere other than the target (out of band)

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-select-oob
globalAttributes.description: select content to swap in from a response, somewhere other than the target (out of band)

globalAttributes.name: hx-swap
globalAttributes.description: controls how content will swap in (`outerHTML`, `beforeend`, `afterend`, ...)

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-swap
globalAttributes.description: controls how content will swap in (`outerHTML`, `beforeend`, `afterend`, ...)

globalAttributes.name: hx-swap-oob
globalAttributes.description: mark element to swap in from a response (out of band)

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-swap-oob
globalAttributes.description: mark element to swap in from a response (out of band)

globalAttributes.name: hx-target
globalAttributes.description: specifies the target element to be swapped

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-target
globalAttributes.description: specifies the target element to be swapped

globalAttributes.name: hx-trigger
globalAttributes.description: specifies the event that triggers the request

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-trigger
globalAttributes.description: specifies the event that triggers the request

globalAttributes.name: hx-vals
globalAttributes.description: add values to submit with the request (JSON format)

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-vals
globalAttributes.description: add values to submit with the request (JSON format)

globalAttributes.name: hx-boost
globalAttributes.description: add [progressive enhancement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Progressive_enhancement) for links and forms

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-boost
globalAttributes.description: add [progressive enhancement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Progressive_enhancement) for links and forms

globalAttributes.name: hx-confirm
globalAttributes.description: shows a `confirm()` dialog before issuing a request

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-confirm
globalAttributes.description: shows a `confirm()` dialog before issuing a request

globalAttributes.name: hx-delete
globalAttributes.description: issues a `DELETE` to the specified URL

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-delete
globalAttributes.description: issues a `DELETE` to the specified URL

globalAttributes.name: hx-disable
globalAttributes.description: disables htmx processing for the given node and any children nodes

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-disable
globalAttributes.description: disables htmx processing for the given node and any children nodes

globalAttributes.name: hx-disabled-elt
globalAttributes.description: adds the `disabled` attribute to the specified elements while a request is in flight

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-disabled-elt
globalAttributes.description: adds the `disabled` attribute to the specified elements while a request is in flight

globalAttributes.name: hx-disinherit
globalAttributes.description: control and disable automatic attribute inheritance for child nodes

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-disinherit
globalAttributes.description: control and disable automatic attribute inheritance for child nodes

globalAttributes.name: hx-encoding
globalAttributes.description: changes the request encoding type

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-encoding
globalAttributes.description: changes the request encoding type

globalAttributes.name: hx-ext
globalAttributes.description: extensions to use for this element

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-ext
globalAttributes.description: extensions to use for this element

globalAttributes.name: hx-headers
globalAttributes.description: adds to the headers that will be submitted with the request

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-headers
globalAttributes.description: adds to the headers that will be submitted with the request

globalAttributes.name: hx-history
globalAttributes.description: prevent sensitive data being saved to the history cache

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-history
globalAttributes.description: prevent sensitive data being saved to the history cache

globalAttributes.name: hx-history-elt
globalAttributes.description: the element to snapshot and restore during history navigation

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-history-elt
globalAttributes.description: the element to snapshot and restore during history navigation

globalAttributes.name: hx-include
globalAttributes.description: include additional data in requests

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-include
globalAttributes.description: include additional data in requests

globalAttributes.name: hx-indicator
globalAttributes.description: the element to put the `htmx-request` class on during the request

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-indicator
globalAttributes.description: the element to put the `htmx-request` class on during the request

globalAttributes.name: hx-inherit
globalAttributes.description: control and enable automatic attribute inheritance for child nodes if it has been disabled by default

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-inherit
globalAttributes.description: control and enable automatic attribute inheritance for child nodes if it has been disabled by default

globalAttributes.name: hx-params
globalAttributes.description: filters the parameters that will be submitted with a request

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-params
globalAttributes.description: filters the parameters that will be submitted with a request

globalAttributes.name: hx-patch
globalAttributes.description: issues a `PATCH` to the specified URL

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-patch
globalAttributes.description: issues a `PATCH` to the specified URL

globalAttributes.name: hx-preserve
globalAttributes.description: specifies elements to keep unchanged between requests

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-preserve
globalAttributes.description: specifies elements to keep unchanged between requests

globalAttributes.name: hx-prompt
globalAttributes.description: shows a `prompt()` before submitting a request

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-prompt
globalAttributes.description: shows a `prompt()` before submitting a request

globalAttributes.name: hx-put
globalAttributes.description: issues a `PUT` to the specified URL

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-put
globalAttributes.description: issues a `PUT` to the specified URL

globalAttributes.name: hx-replace-url
globalAttributes.description: replace the URL in the browser location bar

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-replace-url
globalAttributes.description: replace the URL in the browser location bar

globalAttributes.name: hx-request
globalAttributes.description: configures various aspects of the request

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-request
globalAttributes.description: configures various aspects of the request

globalAttributes.name: hx-sync
globalAttributes.description: control how requests made by different elements are synchronized

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-sync
globalAttributes.description: control how requests made by different elements are synchronized

globalAttributes.name: hx-validate
globalAttributes.description: force elements to validate themselves before a request

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-validate
globalAttributes.description: force elements to validate themselves before a request

globalAttributes.name: hx-vars
globalAttributes.description: adds values dynamically to the parameters to submit with the request (deprecated, please use [`hx-vals`](https://htmx.org/attributes/hx-vals/))

globalAttributes.name: data-hx-vars
globalAttributes.description: adds values dynamically to the parameters to submit with the request (deprecated, please use [`hx-vals`](https://htmx.org/attributes/hx-vals/))

values.name: innerHTML
values.description: Replace the inner html of the target element

values.name: outerHTML
values.description: Replace the entire target element with the response

values.name: textContext
values.description: Replace the text content of the target element, without parsing the response as HTML

values.name: beforebegin
values.description: Insert the response before the target element

values.name: afterbegin
values.description: Insert the response before the first child of the target element

values.name: beforeend
values.description: Insert the response after the last child of the target element

values.name: afterend
values.description: Insert the response after the target element

values.name: delete
values.description: Deletes the target element regardless of the response

values.name: none
values.description: Does not append content from response (out of band items will still be processed).

values.name: innerHTML
values.description: Replace the inner html of the target element

values.name: innerHTML:<CSS selector>
values.description: Replace the inner html of the target element

values.name: outerHTML
values.description: Replace the entire target element with the response

values.name: outerHTML:<CSS selector>
values.description: Replace the entire target element with the response

values.name: textContext
values.description: Replace the text content of the target element, without parsing the response as HTML

values.name: textContext:<CSS selector>
values.description: Replace the text content of the target element, without parsing the response as HTML

values.name: beforebegin
values.description: Insert the response before the target element

values.name: beforebegin:<CSS selector>
values.description: Insert the response before the target element

values.name: afterbegin
values.description: Insert the response before the first child of the target element

values.name: afterbegin:<CSS selector>
values.description: Insert the response before the first child of the target element

values.name: beforeend
values.description: Insert the response after the last child of the target element

values.name: beforeend:<CSS selector>
values.description: Insert the response after the last child of the target element

values.name: afterend
values.description: Insert the response after the target element

values.name: afterend:<CSS selector>
values.description: Insert the response after the target element

values.name: delete
values.description: Deletes the target element regardless of the response

values.name: delete:<CSS selector>
values.description: Deletes the target element regardless of the response

values.name: none
values.description: Does not append content from response (out of band items will still be processed).

values.name: <CSS query selector>
values.description: A CSS query selector of the element to target.

values.name: this
values.description: `this` which indicates that the element that the `hx-target` attribute is on is the target.

values.name: closest <CSS selector>
values.description: `closest <CSS selector>` which will find the [closest](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Element/closest) ancestor element or itself, that matches the given CSS selector (e.g. `closest tr` will target the closest table row to the element).

values.name: find <CSS selector>
values.description: `find <CSS selector>` which will find the first child descendant element that matches the given CSS selector.

values.name: next
values.description: `next` which resolves to [element.nextElementSibling](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Element/nextElementSibling)

values.name: next <CSS selector>
values.description: `next <CSS selector>` which will scan the DOM forward for the first element that matches the given CSS selector. (e.g. `next .error` will target the closest following sibling element with `error` class)

values.name: previous
values.description: `previous` which resolves to [element.previousElementSibling](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Element/previousElementSibling)

values.name: previous <CSS selector>
values.description: `previous <CSS selector>` which will scan the DOM backwards for the first element that matches the given CSS selector. (e.g `previous .error` will target the closest previous sibling with `error` class)
